title: HOW TO: DIY self watering system for plants or trees || Agrosuede

tasks.task: Create a self-watering planter using bottles and string
subtasks: Cut the top off a bottle
Drill a hole in the lid of another bottle
Connect the bottles using a string or rope
Fill the lower bottle with water
Place a cloth or wick between the bottles
Position plants in the upper bottle above the wick
Observe and maintain the water level in the lower bottle

tasks.task: Demonstrating the effectiveness of a self-watering planter
subtasks: Water the upper bottle and observe water movement through the wick
Emphasize the transfer of water from high to low concentration
Check moisture levels in the soil above the wick
Show the growth of a tomato sprout in the upper bottle
Compare moisture levels between the top and bottom of the soil
Explain how gravity and evaporation contribute to water movement

tasks.task: Experimenting with a larger self-watering system
subtasks: Gather materials for a larger planter stand
Propose multiple water sources and cloth placement
Construct the water reservoirs and wicks in the planter stand
Monitor the moisture levels and water distribution in the system
Address potential challenges such as cloth collapse or water pooling
Share reactions to others' gardening ideas (e.g., impromptu tuesday video)
Promote the use of eco-friendly and cost-effective gardening techniques
Invite viewers to try and contribute their own gardening ideas
Provide contact information for video requests
Encourage subscriptions, likes, and social media follow
